text:
Prisoners (Interstate Transfer) Amendment Order 2006

I, the Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council, make the following order-in-council under section 4(1) of the Prisoners (Interstate Transfer) Act 1982 .

4 September 2006

W. J. E. COX

Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

STEVEN KONS

Minister for Justice and Workplace Relations

1. Short title
    This order-in-council may be cited as the Prisoners (Interstate Transfer) Amendment Order 2006 .

2. Commencement
    This order-in-council takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.

3. Principal Order
    In this order-in-council, the Prisoners (Interstate Transfer) Order 1984 is referred to as the Principal Order.

4.
    The amendment effected by this clause has been incorporated into the authorised version of the Prisoners (Interstate Transfer) Order 1984 .

SCHEDULE 1 - Interstate laws

Clause 2

  Column 1 – Law  Column 2 – State or Territory  1.  Crimes (Sentence Administration) Act 2006  Australian Capital Territory  2.  Prisoners (Interstate Transfer) Act 1982  New South Wales  3.  Prisoners (Interstate Transfer) Act 1983  Northern Territory  4.  Prisoners (Interstate Transfer) Act 1982  Queensland  5.  Prisoners (Interstate Transfer) Act 1982  South Australia  6.  Prisoners (Interstate Transfer) Act 1983  Victoria  7.  Prisoners (Interstate Transfer) Act 1983  Western Australia
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               


Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 13 September 2006

This order is administered in the Department of Justice.
